name: SPECIAL OFFER: A Lily bundle pack
description: A copy of A Lily's brand new 'Lupa' EP on 12" vinyl AND a limited print shirt on 100% cotton (design by A Lily, typesetting by Hannah Clare) at a special price!

name: NEW! A Lily - Lupa 12"
description: A Lily is the solo project of Brighton’s James Vella (yndi halda, Saint Coltrane, FatCat Records). Lupa is an EP of self-produced tracks that trails forthcoming full-length Roma. Both EP and album reference the ancient Roman tale of Romulus and Remus – two brothers raised from childhood by a feral wolf, eventually fighting to the death over the formation of the city of Rome. The Romulus and Remus story is magical, surreal, occasionally warm and occasionally vicious. Lyrically and musically, Lupa follows a similar line. It marries dark imagery with harmonious pop forms, softly-whispered vocal deliveries with dense textual arrangements delivered by a broad palette of instrumentation. There are choral vocals, waves of distortion, string quartet arrangements and roughly-hewn bedroom folk across its four tracks. Also included as influences for the making of Roma and Lupa are astronomer Carl Sagan, Twin Peaks characters, K Records founder Calvin Johnson and actress Penelope Cruz. The list is more revealing than one might expect: both records can be seen as studies of wonder, mystery and beauty, all tied within a poetic and descriptive narrative. Recorded entirely at home over several months, almost every instrument was performed by Vella with some additional help from some guest musicians, including Mice Parade’s Adam Pierce and Emiliana Torrini. As a live act, the A Lily band has expanded and contracted to comprise – at various times - a brass ensemble, classical percussion, electronics and keyboards, and multi-part vocal harmonies, but has now settled on a four-piece based around guitar, keyboard, cello, drumkit and voice. Previous live ventures have seen shows with Amiina, Peter Broderick, Silver Apples, yndi halda, Silje Nes and Memoryhouse. A Lily’s previous recorded outings span the organic / electronic laptop, home recording and drone debut album wake:sleep (Dynamophone Records, 2006), an EP of longing Americana named I Dress My Ankles With God’s Sweetest Words (Dynamophone, 2008) and Japan-only pure pop record Thunder Ate The Iron Tree (p*dis, 2011). Vella also co-founded yndi halda and Saint Coltrane, and will shortly publish a short story collection entitled Devourings (Wounded Wold Press, 2014), a similar expression of the dream-like and surreal to Roma and Lupa. Check out the video for The Sparrow In The Lemon Tree here

name: Vincent Vocoder Voice LP
description:
Alex from yndi halda's debut solo LP. A dissonant, home-recorded post-punk LP featuring Olly from yh on drumkit.

Listen here: http://vincentvocodervoice.bandcamp.com/album/vincent-vocoder-voice

180gm heavy vinyl (black), inners inc. lyric sheet w / printed download code.

name: A Lily - Hawaii shirt
description:
design by A Lily, typesetting by Hannah Clare.

Large sunset red print on 100% cotton Gildan Soft Style shirt.

Wearing this is very much like being in Hawaii, probably.

She's a beauty.

name: NEW! The Lunchtime Sardine Club - ICECAPADES LP (and mp3's)
description:
Debut album from The Lunchtime Sardine Club (yndi halda drummer Oh-liver Newton) on 180g vinyl.

Icecapades is a marriage of sweet melody and natural distortion, a collection of fuzzy, psych-folk songs, centred around layers of subdued vocals and dotted with field recordings.  Icecapades is sonically and lyrically dark yet playful, an album which closely ties its subject matter to its sound.

name: yndi halda - enjoy eternal bliss 2xLP (& mp3's)
description: yndi halda's Enjoy Eternal Bliss unfolds through four tracks that clock in at a little more than an hour. This is expansive, epic instrumental music with varied sections and movements that rise to crescendo out of subtle, gentle ambience. Melodies ebb and flow, rising to beautiful explosions. It's the kind of music which could soundtrack a modern day love story as easily as it could a mid-century war. A barrage of instrumentation is woven together to form the fabric of this effort, with soaring violins and whispering glockenspiels, melodies of clarinets and banjos, and driving guitars and bass supported by a military-styled percussion sound. With one beautiful soundscape after another, yndi halda create something bigger than an emotional rollercoaster, it's more like a full-on mountain assault through thick blizzards and incredible sunshine. This is music for all seasons. This is music that will break hearts and mend hearts. Listen here. Please note: the 2xLP is depressingly expensive to send, especially overseas. Apologies for the high shipping prices. But...you get an mp3 coupon for all the songs. Please note II: we have none of these in stock at the moment, so are outsourcing all orders to our US label. This means that UK/Europe/ROW orders may take a couple of weeks to arrive, but US orders will be a lot quicker... Please note III: the 2xLP is on GREY AND PURPLE MARBLE VINYL!

This is expansive, epic instrumental music with varied sections and movements that rise to crescendo out of subtle, gentle ambience. Melodies ebb and flow, rising to beautiful explosions. It's the kind of music which could soundtrack a modern day love story as easily as it could a mid-century war. A barrage of instrumentation is woven together to form the fabric of this effort, with soaring violins and whispering glockenspiels, melodies of clarinets and banjos, and driving guitars and bass supported by a military-styled percussion sound. With one beautiful soundscape after another, yndi halda create something bigger than an emotional rollercoaster, it's more like a full-on mountain assault through thick blizzards and incredible sunshine. This is music for all seasons. This is music that will break hearts and mend hearts. Listen here.

name: Saint Coltrane / Weird Wives split 7"
description:
James and Olly from yh also play in Saint Coltrane:


Enjoyment Records present two brand new tracks of caustic sleaze-punk from Florida's Weird Wives and the UK's Saint Coltrane. This 7" represents both bands' debut single releases, pressed here onto two- or three-colour colour vinyl (see colour options below) with inserts, download codes and digital b-sides.

Saint Coltrane are based in Brighton, UK, and are made up of members of a local collective that comprises bands, artists, labels, blogs and a football team. Having formed on 1st Jan 2011, steadily gaining new ground as a live act - opening shows for Liturgy, Gay for Johnny Depp, Parts & Labor, DD/MM/YYYY, Carlton Melton among others - Iron Dracula is the band's first release. An intense, biting 4 minutes of articulate and skewed hardcore from members of yndi halda and A Lily.

Weird Wives - scene stalwarts in and around their home town of Miami - are a chaotic punk 4-piece that divebomb between apocalyptic, reverberous darkness and elephantine, squalling thunder. Gila, is in name and in character, a monster; their first release following 2011's insane *Some Motherfuckers Gonna Be Walking ‘Round With a Size 9 Diehard up Their Ass, Cause Apparently They Ain’t Never Seen a Short AC Man Get Bad Ass on Methadone *LP.


Vinyl Colours: 
250 x Blue/Grey/White 
250 x Red/Yellow Mix

Digital downloads included with vinyl (featuring additional bonus tracks by both bands!)

name: NEW! O Rosa Records bundle
description: x1 Whip - R. Mutt's Blues CDEP x1 Atkinson-Chauveau - Roman Anglais CD x1 Rivulets - You Are My Home CD A cut-price bundle (worth £24 if bought separately!) of all of O Rosa's output to date. - Whip's gorgeous R. Mutt's Blues CDEP, described as "making the campfire sadness darker" by Drowned in Sound, is finally back in stock after a lengthy delay in stock delivery. - Atkinson-Chauveau - aka Parisian duo Felicia Atkinson (an illustrator and poet) and Type / FatCat's recording asset Sylvain Chauveau - released their flooring, quietly intense Roman Anglais through O Rosa in 2008. Part digitised blips and bleeps, part whispered French-language poetry and part shimmering guitar Saganisms, this is Atkinson-Chauveau's first and only collaborative release. - Rivulets is the recording project of Alaska's Nathan Amundsen. His O Rosa debut You Are My Home was critically acclaimed on release - receiving a giddy, 4-star review from The Sunday Times (among others), who compared the record favourably to Bon Iver and Fleet Foxes. All three releases can be heard in full at orosarecords.com

name: A Lily - wake:sleep shirt

name: A Lily - wake:sleep
description: Tenderness and longing ring true on this roughly hewn album of hand made valentines. The album starts with waking pieces, soft and crunchy, gradually moving towards smooth sleepy washed guitar dreamscapes. 1| i am to you 2| lights shone brighter. my delicate sun is my sparklin' sun 3| leanna is a quiet meow 4| you are the sun, your eyes are the sun 5| aeriels quiet and death-defying 6| the sleepers 7| arms around sleep 8| the shipwreck Listen here.

name: A Lily - I Dress My Ankles with God's Sweetest Words [Parcel EP]
description: From americana to folktronic to minimalist drone, i dress my ankles with god's sweetest words serves as a map to the landscape of A Lily. A tour around the world in 20 minutes. Three stunning and inspired tracks from yndi halda guitarist James Vella. Folktronic, Ambient. For fans of Iron and Wine, Stars of the Lid. 3” CDr Parcel, Limited Edition of 200. 1. A Town Like Hurricane 2. A Song for Ron Mental and Sydney Bishop 3. Hunter and Sky Listen here.

name: Rivulets - You Are My Home (O Rosa Records)
description: We have, in You Are My Home, a wintry, longing and grippingly beautiful record. Moments of warmth are carried – resonate, even – through passages of great yearning. The heartbreakingly lingering finger-picked guitar; warm, full orchestral arrangements and enveloping, delicate vocal deliveries that make up You Are My Home are to be treasured, held close like sunlight in Alaska. The guest musicians on this record are stellar: legendary jazz cellist Fred Lonberg-Holm; Shellac's Bob Weston; Rachel's' Christian Frederickson. This is a record that stands so complete and so singularly in the field; there is enough sentiment here to fill a whole back catalogue of recordings, and O Rosa Records is proud to present this truly breathtaking release. 1 – Glass Houses 2 – Can’t I Wonder 3 – You Are My Home 4 – Heartless 5 – Motioning 6 – Greenhouse 7 – Win or Lose 8 – To Be Home 9 – You Sail On 10 – Happy Ending 11 – Morning Light Listen here NOW ON SALE!

name: Felicia Atkinson & Sylvain Chauveau - Roman Anglais CD (O Rosa Records)
description: Sylvain and Felicia’s debut collaborative effort is quite noticeably the work of two of the field’s most noteworthy songwriters. From Dans La Lumiere’s gentle electronic flickering that brings to mind Labradford or Stars of the Lid, to the gorgeous (and unexpected) English vocals of Aberdeen – “I shot my baby down, down by the riverside” – this record is one that no-one will fail to be stirred by. Like a serene, slow-motion window into the world of Paris’ lively architecture, or a glimpse into where silence meets sound at their closest point. You will not forget this record. Le premier album de Félicia avec Sylvain est une collaboration où l’on peut clairement percevoir le styles respectifs des deux personnages. De l’électronique scintillante et légère de Dans La Lumiere, vision de délicatesse et de grâce dans leurs formes les plus pures, à la surprenante voix anglophone de Aberdeen – « I shot down my baby, down by the river » – une musique qui en remuera plus d’un. Comme un alenti depuis une fenêtre parisienne, ou la rencontre rencontre intime entre le son et le silence. Vous n’oublierez pas cet enregistement. tracklisting: 1 – Aberdeen [6:01] 2 – How The Light [6:24] 3 – Dans La Lumiére [9:48] 4 – Roman Anglais [17:48] Listen here

name: Whip - R. Mutt's Blues CDEP (O Rosa Records)
description: Sweet, hushed tones and delicately cracking vocals with plaintive and genuinely stirring lyrics. R. Mutt’s Blues is the record that saw Jason slowly return from almost dead; after an entire year of phonographic inactivity, the first months of 2007 saw Whip release this stunning EP and accompanying full length, as well as some wonderful live performances on this side of that great Atlantic. The title refers to Marcel Duchamp’s oft-misunderstood Dadaist masterpiece ‘Fountain’, and is a knowing and cheerful allegory to something we may never understand. These songs will melt hearts. tracklisting: 1 – Beast of Each 2 – How Can I Turn 3 – Swim for Shore 4 – Great Wall of China 5 – Wrecking Crew Listen here Back in stock!
